name: Madhubani
description: Madhubani art is a traditional folk painting from Bihar, characterized by intricate patterns, vibrant colors, and themes of mythology, rituals, and nature.

name: Warli
materialused: White pigment from rice paste, mud walls
description: Warli art is a tribal mural painting style featuring simple geometric figures depicting daily life, farming, hunting, and rituals.

name: Tanjore
materialused: Gold foil, wooden planks, natural pigments
description: Tanjore paintings are classical South Indian artworks known for rich colors, surface richness, and use of gold leaf to depict deities.

name: Pattachitra
description: Pattachitra is a scroll painting tradition depicting mythological themes with intricate borders and bold colors.

name: Kalamkari
description: Kalamkari is a hand-painted or block-printed cotton textile art with themes from epics like Ramayana and Mahabharata.

name: Phad
description: Phad painting is a traditional scroll painting style depicting local deities and folk stories, often used in traveling performances.

name: Miniature Painting
description: Indian miniature paintings are detailed artworks depicting court life, battles, and religious themes with fine detailing.

name: Bhil Art
description: Bhil art uses vibrant dots and patterns to depict nature, animals, and tribal myths, rooted in Bhil community traditions.

name: Manjusha Art
description: Manjusha painting is a folk art associated with the Bishahari festival, depicting serpent motifs and mythological stories.

name: Kerala Mural
description: Kerala murals are temple paintings featuring Hindu deities, mythological scenes, and natural themes in earthy tones.

name: Chitrakathi
description: Chitrakathi is a narrative painting tradition where scrolls are used to tell epic and folklore stories, accompanied by songs.

name: Gond Art
description: Gond paintings are tribal artworks with intricate lines and dots, depicting animals, folklore, and daily life.

name: Patua
description: Patua art consists of scroll paintings created by traditional singing painters who narrate stories from epics and folklore.

name: Batik
description: Batik is a wax-resist dyeing technique used to create intricate designs on textiles, popular in Bengal and Gujarat.

name: Sanjhi
description: Sanjhi art is a traditional paper-cutting craft from Mathura, often depicting Radha-Krishna themes and temple decorations.

name: Khovar Art
description: Khovar is a traditional wall painting art done by women during marriage rituals, using comb patterns and natural dyes.

name: Sohrai Art
description: Sohrai painting is a harvest festival art where walls are decorated with motifs of animals, plants, and tribal symbols.

name: Bastar Art
description: Bastar art includes tribal metal craft, wood carving, and terracotta work, reflecting tribal rituals and daily life.

name: Rogan Painting
description: Rogan painting is a rare hand-painting technique on fabric using thick castor oil-based colors, practiced in Kutch region.

name: Kalighat Painting
description: Kalighat paintings originated near Kalighat temple in Kolkata, blending folk themes with modern urban influences.
